Description: Base and flaring foot of Chian, possibly Mature Animal Style or Simple Animal Style, pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed (fired red) with part of cross in added white and red dots; exterior: glazed very streakily (fired mostly red). Underside reserved.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

According to Dupont and Thomas (2006, p. 79, NAU27), the geophysical characteristics of the fabric indicate that the sherd originated in Chios. The sample number 'NAU 37' is written in ink on break. For parallels, see the Mature Animal Style chalice from Pitane, now in the Istanbul Museum (Lemos 1991, no. 2267, pl. 87, no. 674).
Bibliographic references: Dupont & Thomas 2006 / Naukratis: Les Importations Grecques Orientales Archaïques (p. 78-9, p. 82-3, fig. 2) (NAU 37)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0696) (phase 2)
